original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo tshe 'das nas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo tshe 'das nas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: And, son of a good family, daughter of a good family, after death, they will accomplish these six perfections.

original: de dag ni nam sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma byas /
analyzed: de dag ni nam sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma byas /
translated: They will not relax their effort in the six perfections as they have been taught until they have purified a Buddha-field,

original: sems can yongs su smin par ma byas /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par ma byas /
translated: until they have brought beings to maturity,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ma gyur gyi bar du ji skad du bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag las brtson 'grus nyams par mi byed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ma gyur gyi bar du ji skad du bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag las brtson 'grus nyams par mi byed do //
translated: and until they have manifested complete knowing.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las; le'u sum cu pa'o ////
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las; le'u sum cu pa'o ////
translated: This was the thirtieth chapter, “The Perfection of Effort,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines

original: bam po nyis brgya bdun pa //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /🔽bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bam po nyis brgya bdun pa // de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis / bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Volume 2🔽Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs pa /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs pa /
translated: “Blessed One, if the qualities of those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who have set out in the Great Vehicle,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa /
translated: who practice the six perfections,

original: sems can yongs su smin par bgyid pa /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bgyid pa /
translated: who bring sentient beings to full maturity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su 'dzin par bgyid pa de dag gi yon tan yongs su brjod pa ni 'di dag lags na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su 'dzin par bgyid pa de dag gi yon tan yongs su brjod pa ni 'di dag lags na /
translated: and who take hold of the buddhafields are described in this way,

original: @62b bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: @62b bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu spyod pa de dag la bar chad du 'gyur ba ji lta bu dag mchis /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu spyod pa de dag la bar chad du 'gyur ba ji lta bu dag mchis /
translated: what sort of obstacles will there be for those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who practice the Great Vehicle?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / spobs pa ha cang 'phyi ste skye na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / spobs pa ha cang 'phyi ste skye na /
translated: if eloquence arises too late,

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being should recognize this to be a work of Māra.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Subhūti then asked, “Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du spobs pa ha cang 'phyi ste skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i slad du spobs pa ha cang 'phyi ste skye bar 'gyur /
translated: why does eloquence arise too late?”

original: de ni ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bgyi /
analyzed: de ni ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bgyi /
translated: Why should bodhisattva great beings know them to be the work of Māra?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ba'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, here when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dka' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dka' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: they complete the perfection of wisdom with difficulty,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dka' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed /🔽brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dka' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dka' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dka' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: they complete the perfection of concentration with difficulty,🔽they complete the perfection of perseverance with difficulty,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dka' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dka' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: they complete the perfection of patience with difficulty,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dka' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dka' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: they complete the perfection of morality with difficulty,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dka' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dka' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed na /
translated: and they complete the perfection of giving with difficulty.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des shin tu 'phyi ste skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des shin tu 'phyi ste skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhuti, for this reason, it will arise very slowly.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva-mahāsattva should know this as Māra's doing.

original: rab 'byor / @63a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / @63a *//
translated: Subhuti,

original: gzhan yang shin tu myur bar spobs pa skye na /
analyzed: gzhan yang shin tu myur bar spobs pa skye na /
translated: furthermore, if eloquence arises very quickly,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva should know this as Māra's doing.🔽Subhuti said:

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: ci'i slad du shin tu myur bar spobs pa skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i slad du shin tu myur bar spobs pa skye bar 'gyur /
translated: why does eloquence arise very quickly?

original: de ni ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bgyi /
analyzed: de ni ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bgyi /
translated: Why should the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva know this as Māra's doing?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: Subhuti, here the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices the perfection of giving, who practices the perfection of morality, who practices the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mi mkhas pas ha cang myur bar spobs pa skye la des rlom sems su byed na /
analyzed: thabs mi mkhas pas ha cang myur bar spobs pa skye la des rlom sems su byed na /
translated: if, due to a lack of skill in means, they give rise to eloquence too quickly and become conceited about it,

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na spobs pa he cang myur bar skye ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na spobs pa he cang myur bar skye ba ste /
translated: Subhūti, for that reason eloquence arises too quickly

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: and bodhisattva great beings should know it to be the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang glal cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dri 'dri na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang glal cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dri 'dri na /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, if someone yawns while writing out the perfection of wisdom,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should know that too to be the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang dgod cing 'dri na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang dgod cing 'dri na /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, if someone laughs while writing it out,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems @63b dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems @63b dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should know that too to be the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / phan tshun steg cing 'dri na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / phan tshun steg cing 'dri na /
translated: Subhuti, if they are mutually flattering and asking questions,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva-mahasattva should know that this is the work of Mara.

original: sems g-yeng zhing 'dri na /
analyzed: sems g-yeng zhing 'dri na /
translated: Subhuti, if they are asking questions with a distracted mind,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva-mahasattva should know that this is the work of Mara.

original: yi ge gzhan la chags shing tshig gi don mi shes par 'dri na /
analyzed: yi ge gzhan la chags shing tshig gi don mi shes par 'dri na /
translated: Subhuti, if they are asking questions attached to other letters and not knowing the meaning of the words,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva-mahasattva should know that this is the work of Mara.

original: 'di'i rom myong nas stan las langs te 'gro na /
analyzed: 'di'i rom myong nas stan las langs te 'gro na /
translated: Subhuti, if after experiencing this, they get up from their seats and leave,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva-mahasattva should know that this is the work of Mara.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang glag ming lung 'bog na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang glag ming lung 'bog na /
translated: Subhuti, furthermore, if they are giving the precepts of the Dharma,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva-mahasattva should know that this is the work of Mara.

original: glal cing kha ton byed dam /
analyzed: glal cing kha ton byed dam /
translated: or when they are yawning, reciting,

original: 'dzin tam / klog gam /
analyzed: 'dzin tam / klog gam /
translated: receiving, reading,

original: ston pa dang / glal cing tshul bzhin du yid la byed na /
analyzed: ston pa dang / glal cing tshul bzhin du yid la byed na /
translated: expounding, or properly paying attention while yawning,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings should also recognize this to be the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phan tshun dgong cing 'dzin tam /🔽'chang ngam / klog gam /🔽kun chub par byed dam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phan tshun dgong cing 'dzin tam / 'chang ngam / klog gam / kun chub par byed dam /
translated: “Moreover, Su­bhūti, when they are receiving, holding,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed na //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed na //
translated: mastering, reading aloud, and properly paying attention to this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom while they are quarreling with one another,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang phan tshun @64a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o // rab 'byor / gzhan yang phan tshun @64a *//
translated: Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings should also recognize this to be the work of Māra.

original: steg cing 'dzin tam /🔽'chang ngam / klog gam /🔽kun chub bar byed dam /
analyzed: steg cing 'dzin tam / 'chang ngam / klog gam / kun chub bar byed dam /
translated: “Moreover, Su­bhūti, when they are receiving, holding,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed na /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed na /
translated: mastering, reading aloud, and properly paying attention to this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom while they are boasting to one another,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings should also recognize this to be the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang sems g-yeng bas 'dzin tam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang sems g-yeng bas 'dzin tam /
translated: “Moreover, Su­bhūti, when they are receiving, holding,🔽mastering, reading aloud, and properly paying attention to this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom while their minds are distracted,

original: 'chang ngam / klog gam /🔽kun chub par byed dam /
analyzed: 'chang ngam / klog gam / kun chub par byed dam /
translated: if they hold, read aloud,🔽master,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed na /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed na /
translated: or properly pay attention to it,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should know that this too is the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang yi ge gzhan dang gzhan la chags shing 'dzin tam /🔽'chang ngam / klog gam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang yi ge gzhan dang gzhan la chags shing 'dzin tam / 'chang ngam / klog gam /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, if they are attached to and hold on to the other letters,

original: kun chub par byed dam /
analyzed: kun chub par byed dam /
translated: if they hold, read aloud,🔽master,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed na /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed na /
translated: or properly pay attention to it,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o; ;de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o; ;de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should know that this too is the work of Māra.”

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du 'di'i ro ma myong nas stan las langs te 'gro na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du 'di'i ro ma myong nas stan las langs te 'gro na /
translated: “Lord, the Lord has said, ‘If they get up from their seats without tasting it,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: Subhuti, this also should be known as the work of Mara.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhuti said, Bhagavan,

original: ci'i slad du 'di'i ro mi myong bar 'gyur /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ci'i slad du 'di'i ro mi myong bar 'gyur / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: why is it that they do not taste it?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sngon shes rab kyi @64b pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sngon shes rab kyi @64b pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: The Bhagavan replied, Subhuti, it is because those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas have not previously practiced the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ma spyad pa de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ma spyad pa de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity. When this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las bdag cag lung ma bstan to zhes ma dad pa'i yid kyis stan las langs shing 'dong ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las bdag cag lung ma bstan to zhes ma dad pa'i yid kyis stan las langs shing 'dong ste /
translated: They will get up from their seats and leave with a mind of lack of faith, saying, ‘We have not been prophesied in this perfection of wisdom.’

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should know that this too is the work of Māra.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las lung ma bstan pa de dag stan las langs shing mchi bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las lung ma bstan pa de dag stan las langs shing mchi bar 'gyur /
translated: why do those who have not been prophesied in the perfection of wisdom get up from their seats and leave?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyon med par ma chud pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyon med par ma chud pa ni /
translated: “Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings who have not entered into faultlessness

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung mi bstan to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung mi bstan to //
translated: are not prophesied for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de la bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las mi 'byung ngo //
translated: They will think, ‘I am not coming forth from this perfection of wisdom.

original: bdag gi ming yang yongs su ma brjod do zhes bdud ma gyur na /

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shing gi rtsa ba spangs te de nyid kyi yan lag dang / 'dab ma dang / lo ma la 'ju bar sems par gyur pa dag ste /

translated: Therefore, those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle will reject the root of the tree of the knowledge of a knower of all aspects and will think that they should master the branches, leaves, and petals of that tree.

analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa'i sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //

translated: “Lord,

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa de dag ste /

original: 'di ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: They are the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of awakening, and the noble eightfold path.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams te /
translated: They are the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, and the wishlessness gate of liberation.🔽Abiding in those, sons of noble family

original: de dag la gnas shing rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: de dag la gnas shing rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: The sons of the Victorious Ones who abide in these four🔽

analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa dang / rang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: “Sons and daughters of good family will attain the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, and individual enlightenment,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob bar mi 'gyur ba ste /

translated: Subhūti, those are the sūtras connected with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, in which they think that the perfection of wisdom should be omitted and completed,

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su mi sgrub pa'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

translated: Subhuti : The perfection of wisdom, O Lord, is the perfection of the isolated.🔽The Lord : Because of the isolation of form, etc.🔽Subhuti : The perfection of wisdom, O Lord, is the perfection of the signless.🔽The Lord : Because of the signlessness of form, etc.🔽Subhuti : The perfection of wisdom, O Lord, is the perfection of the wishless.🔽The Lord : Because of the wishlessness of form, etc.🔽Subhuti : The perfection of wisdom, O Lord, is the perfection of the uneffected.🔽The Lord : Because of the uneffectedness of form, etc.

analyzed: rab 'byor / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa 'di bor te /
translated: Subhuti, in the future there will be sons and daughters of good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle who will abandon this perfection of wisdom, the root of all the dharmas of the Buddhas, and

analyzed: yal ga dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma lta bu'i mdo sde nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa dag la brten par sems pa 'byung ste /

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o /

translated: “Subhūti, it is also the case that sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage in the Bodhisattva Vehicle who have abandoned this deep perfection of wisdom will think to master the sūtras connected with śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas for the sake of profit and honor.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should know that this too is the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / mi la la zhig glang po 'dod la des glang po rnyed nas @66b glang po'i rjes bcal bar sems pa yod na /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zag gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor zhing mdo sde gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa de dag btsal bar sems pa dag kyang dpe de dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, you should know that those persons in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas who reject this deep perfection of wisdom and seek out those sūtras that are connected with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are like that.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /

translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / mi zhig rgya mtsho chen po blta bar 'dod la /

translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family are writing out this deep perfection of wisdom,

translated: they will be distracted by the many kinds of eloquence that will arise, and they will not write out this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar gzugs kyi spobs pa dang / sgra'i spobs pa dang / dri'i spobs pa dang / ro'i spobs pa dang / reg gi spobs pa dang / chos kyi spobs pa dang / sbyin pa'i spobs pa dang / tshul khrims kyi spobs pa dang / bzod pa'i spobs pa dang /🔽brtson 'grus kyi spobs pa dang / bsam gtan gyi spobs pa dang / @69b shes rab kyi spobs pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi spobs pa dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi spobs pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi spobs pa dang / lung dbog pa dang /
