original: chos smra ba ni 'dod pa'i sred pa dang bcas /
analyzed: chos smra ba ni 'dod pa'i sred pa dang bcas /
translated: but the one who teaches the Dharma is not free from craving for desire,🔽not free from malice,

original: gnod sems dang / snyom pa dang / gnyid @83b dang; 'gyod pa dang bcas /
analyzed: gnod sems dang / snyom pa dang / gnyid @83b dang; 'gyod pa dang bcas /
translated: not free from laziness, not free from regret,

original: the tshom dang bcas par gyur na /
analyzed: the tshom dang bcas par gyur na /
translated: and not free from doubt.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung dbog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste; rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung dbog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste; rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti, this is also a condition that is not conducive to the writing,

original: de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: This also, Subhūti, should be known as the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / 'chang ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / 'chang ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, written down, taken up, read aloud, mastered, venerated, and properly paid attention to,

original: la la zhig der 'ongs te /
analyzed: la la zhig der 'ongs te /
translated: someone may come there

original: sems can dmyal ba'i mi snyan pa brjod /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i mi snyan pa brjod /
translated: and speak unpleasantly about the hells,

original: byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / yi dvags kyi yul gyi mi snyan pa brjod cing /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / yi dvags kyi yul gyi mi snyan pa brjod cing /
translated: the animal realm, the world of Yama, and the realm of hungry ghosts,

original: sems can dmyal ba ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal lo //🔽byol song gi skye gnas ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal lo; ;gshin rje'i 'jig rten ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal lo // byol song gi skye gnas ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal lo; ;gshin rje'i 'jig rten ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal lo //
translated: saying, ‘The hells are like this: they are suffering.🔽The animal realm is like this: it is suffering. The world of Yama is like this: it is suffering.

original: yi dvags kyi yul ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: yi dvags kyi yul ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The realm of hungry ghosts is like this: it is suffering.

original: khyod kyis sdug bsngal 'di nyid du mthar phyin par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis sdug bsngal 'di nyid du mthar phyin par gyis shig /
translated: You should put an end to this suffering right here and now.’

original: gang la sdug bsngal stong phrag mang po nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gang la sdug bsngal stong phrag mang po nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas /
translated: “What is the use of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment to you?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis khyod la ci zhig bya /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis khyod la ci zhig bya /
translated: You will experience many thousands of sufferings.

original: khyod yun ring por 'khor ba na 'khor bar gyur te re zhes zer na /
analyzed: khyod yun ring por 'khor ba na 'khor bar gyur te re zhes zer na /
translated: You will wander for a long time in cyclic existence.”

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /🔽rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems @84a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste / rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems @84a *//
translated: Subhūti, this also is a condition that does not facilitate writing out, reading aloud, reciting from memory, teaching, or properly paying attention to this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, this also should be known by the bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / 'chang ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / 'chang ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when this deep perfection of wisdom is being written out, read aloud, recited from memory, taught, and properly paid attention to,

original: la la zhig der 'ongs te /
analyzed: la la zhig der 'ongs te /
translated: someone may come there

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod cing /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod cing /
translated: They praise the gods of the Heaven of the Four Kings.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /🔽mtshe ma'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod / mtshe ma'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: They praise the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.🔽They praise the gods of the Yāma Heaven.

original: dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /🔽'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod / 'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: They praise the gods of the Tuṣita Heaven.🔽They praise the gods of the Nirmāṇarati Heaven.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /🔽tshangs ris kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /🔽tshangs lha nye phan gyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod / tshangs ris kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod / tshangs lha nye phan gyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: They praise the gods of the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin Heaven.🔽They praise the gods of the Brahmakāyika Heaven.🔽They praise the gods of the Brahmapurohita Heaven.

original: tshangs pa kun 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: tshangs pa kun 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: They praise the gods of the Brahmapārṣadya Heaven.

original: tshangs chen gyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /🔽snang ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: tshangs chen gyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod / snang ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: They praise the gods of the Mahābrahmāṇa Heaven.🔽They praise the gods of the Ābhāsvara Heaven.

original: chung snang gi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /🔽tshad med snang ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: chung snang gi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod / tshad med snang ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: They praise the gods of the Parīttābha Heaven.🔽They praise the gods of the Apramāṇābha Heaven.

original: kun snang dang ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: kun snang dang ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: They praise the gods of the Ābhāsvara Heaven.

original: dge ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: dge ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: they praise the gods of the virtuous gods,

original: chung dge'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /🔽tshad med dge ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: chung dge'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod / tshad med dge ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: they praise the gods of the lesser virtuous gods,🔽they praise the gods of the immeasurable virtuous gods,

original: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /🔽che ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod / che ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: they praise the gods of the virtuous gods with abundant virtue,🔽they praise the gods of the greater gods,

original: chung che'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: chung che'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: they praise the gods of the lesser greater gods,

original: tshad med che ba'i lha rnams kyi legs @84b pa brjod /
analyzed: tshad med che ba'i lha rnams kyi legs @84b pa brjod /
translated: they praise the gods of the immeasurable greater gods,

original: 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /🔽mi che ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod / mi che ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: they praise the gods of the greater result gods,🔽they praise the gods of the greater gods,

original: mi gdung ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /🔽shin tu mthong ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: mi gdung ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod / shin tu mthong ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: they praise the gods of the untroubled gods,🔽they praise the gods of the very visible gods,

original: gya nom snang ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod //🔽'og min gyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: gya nom snang ba'i lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod // 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: they praise the gods of the sublime appearance gods,🔽they praise the gods of the Akaniṣṭha gods,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: they praise the gods of the sphere of infinite space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: they praise the gods of the sphere of infinite consciousness,

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod /
translated: He praises the gods of the Sphere of Nothingness.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod cing /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha rnams kyi legs pa brjod cing /
translated: He praises the gods of the Sphere of Neither Perception nor Non-Perception.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pas 'di ltar bde'o //🔽gzugs kyi khams ni bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyis 'di ltar bde'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pas 'di ltar bde'o // gzugs kyi khams ni bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyis 'di ltar bde'o //
translated: He says, ‘The desire realm is happy because of enjoying desires.🔽The form realm is happy because of meditative concentration and meditative absorption.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni snyoms par 'jug pa zha ba rnams kyis 'di ltar bde ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni snyoms par 'jug pa zha ba rnams kyis 'di ltar bde ste /
translated: The formless realm is happy because of the meditative absorptions.

original: de dag kyang mi rtag cing sdug bsngal la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi rtag cing sdug bsngal la bdag med pa'o //
translated: But they are impermanent, suffering, and without self.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can /
translated: They are subject to change.

original: zad pa'i chos can /
analyzed: zad pa'i chos can /
translated: They are subject to destruction.

original: 'jigs pa'i chos can /
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i chos can /
translated: They are subject to fear.

original: skye ba'i chos can /
analyzed: skye ba'i chos can /
translated: They are subject to birth.

original: 'gag pa'i chos can yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i chos can yin gyi /
translated: They are subject to cessation.

original: khyod kyis 'di nyid du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'di nyid du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyis shig /
translated: You should attain the fruit of stream-entry right here.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob par gyis shig /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob par gyis shig /
translated: attain the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, and the fruit of arhatship;

original: 'di nyid du rang byang chub thob par gyis shig /
analyzed: 'di nyid du rang byang chub thob par gyis shig /
translated: attain the pratyekabuddha’s awakening right here;

original: phyin chad 'khor ba nam 'khar bar gyis shig ces zer na /
analyzed: phyin chad 'khor ba nam 'khar bar gyis shig ces zer na /
translated: and do not wander in saṃsāra from now on.’

original: rab 'byor / de'ang @85a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang @85a *//
translated: Subhūti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: that also is a condition that is not conducive to writing out, or taking up, or reading aloud, or properly paying attention to this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, that also should be known by bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos smra ba ni gcig pu ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos smra ba ni gcig pu ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the dharma teacher is alone,

original: zla med cing bdag gis byed pa yin la /
analyzed: zla med cing bdag gis byed pa yin la /
translated: without a companion, and does it himself,

original: chos nyan pa ni 'khor gyi nang na gnas na /
analyzed: chos nyan pa ni 'khor gyi nang na gnas na /
translated: while the dharma listener is in the midst of an assembly.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen ma ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen ma ldan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, this also is a condition that does not accompany the writing out, the taking up, the reading, or the recitation of this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, this also should be known by the bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos nyan pa ni gcig pu ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos nyan pa ni gcig pu ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the Dharma listener is alone,

original: zla med cing bdag gis byed pa yin la /
analyzed: zla med cing bdag gis byed pa yin la /
translated: without a companion, and does it by himself,

original: chos smra ba ni 'khor gyi nang na gnas na /
analyzed: chos smra ba ni 'khor gyi nang na gnas na /
translated: while the Dharma preacher is in the midst of an assembly.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, this also is a condition that does not accompany the writing out, the taking up, the reading, or the recitation of this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, this also should be known by the bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos smra ba ni gcig pu ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos smra ba ni gcig pu ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the Dharma preacher is alone,

original: zla med cing bdag gis byed pa yin la /
analyzed: zla med cing bdag gis byed pa yin la /
translated: without a companion, and does it by himself,

original: chos nyan pa ni tshogs yongs su sdud na /
analyzed: chos nyan pa ni tshogs yongs su sdud na /
translated: If the listener is gathering a following,🔽Su­bhūti, this is also a causal condition that will not facilitate the writing,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: reciting, and perfect realization of this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems @85b dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems @85b dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Su­bhūti, this should also be known as a deed of Māra by great bodhisattva beings.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos nyan pa ni gcig pu ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos nyan pa ni gcig pu ste /
translated: “Moreover, Su­bhūti, if the listener is alone,

original: zla med cing bdag gis byed pa yin la /
analyzed: zla med cing bdag gis byed pa yin la /
translated: without a companion, and is self-sufficient,

original: chos smra ba ni tshogs yongs su sdud na /
analyzed: chos smra ba ni tshogs yongs su sdud na /
translated: but the expounder of the teaching is gathering a following,🔽Su­bhūti, this is also a causal condition that will not facilitate the writing,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: reciting, and perfect realization of this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Su­bhūti, this should also be known as a deed of Māra by great bodhisattva beings.

original: rab 'byor // gzhan yang chos smra ba ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: rab 'byor // gzhan yang chos smra ba ni 'di skad du /
translated: “Moreover, Su­bhūti, if the expounder of the teaching were to say,

original: su nga'i phyi bzhin 'brang ba de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'drir sbyin no zhes zer la /
analyzed: su nga'i phyi bzhin 'brang ba de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'drir sbyin no zhes zer la /
translated: I will give to whoever follows me the perfection of wisdom to copy.”

original: chos nyan pa ni phyi bzhin mi 'brang na /
analyzed: chos nyan pa ni phyi bzhin mi 'brang na /
translated: If the listener does not follow the teacher,🔽Subhūti, that also is not having the conditions for copying, reading aloud,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: or reciting this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //

analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, that also is not having the conditions for writing, receiving the transmission of, or reciting this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor; de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor; de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings should know that to be the work of Māra.

analyzed: de'i phyir chos ston pa des kyang /

analyzed: de'ang mi dga' zhing 'di snyam du 'du shes te / 'di ni sbyin par 'dod pa'i mtshan ma ma yin gyi /

translated: to the taking up, to the studying, to the maintaining, to the reading, to the🔽reciting, to the explaining, to the perfect exposition of this deep perfection🔽of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, this should be known as the work of Māra,

translated: wildernesses,🔽and the dharma students, thirsty for the Dharma, follow him for the sake of

analyzed: chos nyan pa dag kyang chos @87b kyi don du chos kyis skom zhing rjes su 'brang na /
translated: the Dharma,

analyzed: dge slong chos smra bas chos nyan pa de dag la 'di skad smras te /
translated: The monk who teaches the Dharma says to those who listen to the Dharma,

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: ‘Sons of noble family,

original: khyod gang na rkun po'i 'jigs pa dang / chom po'i 'jigs pa dang / rngon pa'i 'jigs pa dang / gcan gzan khro bo'i 'jigs pa dang / sprul gyi 'jigs pa dang / 'brog dgon pa'i 'jigs pa yod pa der dong ste ci rung /
analyzed: khyod gang na rkun po'i 'jigs pa dang / chom po'i 'jigs pa dang / rngon pa'i 'jigs pa dang / gcan gzan khro bo'i 'jigs pa dang / sprul gyi 'jigs pa dang / 'brog dgon pa'i 'jigs pa yod pa der dong ste ci rung /
translated: what is the point of your going to places where there are dangers from thieves, dangers from bandits, dangers from hunters, dangers from ferocious wild animals, dangers from snakes, and dangers from the wilderness?’

original: zhes de ltar dge slong chos smra ba des chos mi bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes de ltar dge slong chos smra ba des chos mi bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, the monk who teaches the Dharma does not teach the Dharma.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'drir gzhug pa'i mi 'dod /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'drir gzhug pa'i mi 'dod /

original: klog tu gzhug par mi 'dod /🔽lung 'bog par mi 'dod /
analyzed: klog tu gzhug par mi 'dod / lung 'bog par mi 'dod /

original: kha ton byed du gzhug par mi 'dod /
analyzed: kha ton byed du gzhug par mi 'dod /

original: nyan du gzhug par mi 'dod par gyur la /
analyzed: nyan du gzhug par mi 'dod par gyur la /

original: de dag gis dge slong chos smra ba'i tshig de dag thos nas /
analyzed: de dag gis dge slong chos smra ba'i tshig de dag thos nas /

original: mi dga' zhing mi dga' ba'i tshul can du gyur te /
analyzed: mi dga' zhing mi dga' ba'i tshul can du gyur te /

original: dge slong chos smra ba gang na ba der 'gro bar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: dge slong chos smra ba gang na ba der 'gro bar mi 'dod na /

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, that also is not a condition for writing out, reading aloud, reciting, or mastering this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, that also should be known by the bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.

translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the monk who expounds the Dharma makes the city that gives alms its priority.🔽Because that city that gives alms is his priority, he thinks again and again about that city that gives alms.

original: der yang dang yang blta bar sems nyan pa phyir bzlog @88a *//
analyzed: der yang dang yang blta bar sems nyan pa phyir bzlog @88a *//
translated: He thinks again and again about that city, and he turns away the listeners,

original: cing / tshe dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: cing / tshe dang ldan pa dag /

analyzed: ngas ni bsod snyoms gtong ba'i grong blta dgos te /
translated: I have to look at the city that gives alms.

original: bsod snyoms gtong ba'i grong du 'gro dgos so zhes zer nas /
analyzed: bsod snyoms gtong ba'i grong du 'gro dgos so zhes zer nas /
translated: I must go to the village to beg for alms.”

original: des chos nyan pa de dag phyir bzlog pa'i phyir 'dod na /
analyzed: des chos nyan pa de dag phyir bzlog pa'i phyir 'dod na /
translated: If, Subhūti, he wishes to turn away those who listen to the Dharma,🔽then, Subhūti, this is also a condition that does not facilitate the writing,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: the reading aloud, and the recitation of this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being should know this to be the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang 'dud sdig to can dge slong gi cha byad du byas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang 'dud sdig to can dge slong gi cha byad du byas shing /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one, having become a monk,

original: ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di su'ang 'dri bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lung 'bog par mi 'gyur ba dang / kha ton byed par mi 'gyur ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed par mi 'gyur ba de lta de ltar thabs sbyor ro //
analyzed: ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di su'ang 'dri bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lung 'bog par mi 'gyur ba dang / kha ton byed par mi 'gyur ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed par mi 'gyur ba de lta de ltar thabs sbyor ro //
translated: will apply himself in such a way that no one at all will ask about this deep perfection of wisdom, will not read it aloud, will not recite it, and will not attend to it properly.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, if the perfection of wisdom is not made, not unmade, not given, not taken away, not produced, not stopped, not defiled, not spotless, not diminished, not increased, then how should a Bodhisattva stand in the perfection of wisdom?🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord,

original: ci'i slad du bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du bgyis shing /
analyzed: ci'i slad du bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du bgyis shing /
translated: why do those māra-­generated bhikṣus,

original: ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di su'ang 'dri bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lung 'bog par mi 'gyur ba dang / kha ton byed par mi 'gyur ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid par mi 'gyur ba de lta de ltar thabs sbyor pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di su'ang 'dri bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lung 'bog par mi 'gyur ba dang / kha ton byed par mi 'gyur ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid par mi 'gyur ba de lta de ltar thabs sbyor pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: having taken on the guise of bhikṣus, apply themselves in such a way that no one at all will ask about this deep perfection of wisdom, will not take it up, will not bear it in mind, will not recite it, and will not properly pay attention to it?”🔽The Lord said, “Subhūti, here those māra-­generated bhikṣus,

original: rab 'byor / @88b 'di la bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du byas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / @88b 'di la bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du byas shing /
translated: having taken on the guise of bhikṣus,

original: 'di skad du nged kyis ji ltar khong du chud pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du nged kyis ji ltar khong du chud pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yin te /
translated: will say, ‘This is the perfection of wisdom as we understand it.’

original: ji skad du khyed klog pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes dbyen byed cing bzlog la mos pa med par byed do //
analyzed: ji skad du khyed klog pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes dbyen byed cing bzlog la mos pa med par byed do //
translated: They will cause division, and will turn people away from it, and will make them lose interest in it.

original: rab 'byor / de la bdud sdig te can gyis de ltar dbyen byas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la bdud sdig te can gyis de ltar dbyen byas pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when Māra the wicked one has caused division in that way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang lung ma bstan pa de dag ni the tshom skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang lung ma bstan pa de dag ni the tshom skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: those bodhisattvas who have not been predicted will have doubts.

original: de dag the tshom du gyur nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag the tshom du gyur nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri bar 'gyur /
translated: And when they have doubts, they will not ask questions about this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: mi klog par 'gyur /🔽lung mi 'bog par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi klog par 'gyur / lung mi 'bog par 'gyur /
translated: They will not read it.🔽They will not take it up.

original: kha ton mi byed par 'gyur /🔽mi sgom par 'gyur /
analyzed: kha ton mi byed par 'gyur / mi sgom par 'gyur /
translated: They will not recite it.🔽They will not meditate on it.

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They will not attend to it properly.🔽Subhūti, that also is a condition that is not conducive to writing out,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: or taking up, or reading aloud, or mastering, or explaining, or reciting this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, this also should be known as the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du byas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du byas nas /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one, having assumed the guise of a monk,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du 'ongs shing 'di skad du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du 'ongs shing 'di skad du /
translated: approaches a bodhisattva great being and says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de ni yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de ni yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byed par 'gyur te /
translated: ‘The bodhisattva great beings who practice this profound perfection of wisdom actualize the limit of reality,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ro //🔽de ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i @89a *//
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ro // de ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i @89a *//
translated: and they will attain the fruit of stream enterer.🔽They will attain the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner,

original: 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the fruit of arhat.

original: de ni rang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: de ni rang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
translated: They will attain individual enlightenment.’

original: des tshig de thos nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod na /
analyzed: des tshig de thos nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod na /
translated: If, on hearing those words, they do not practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Su­bhūti, this is also a causal factor that prevents them from copying, reciting, or explaining this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Su­bhūti, this also should be known as the work of Māra by great bodhisattva beings.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa'i tshe /
translated: “Moreover, Su­bhūti, when this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom is being taught,

original: bar chad du 'gyur ba'i bdud kyi las mang du 'byung ste /
analyzed: bar chad du 'gyur ba'i bdud kyi las mang du 'byung ste /
translated: many of the works of Māra will occur as obstacles.

original: bdud kyi las de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Those works of Māra should be known as the works of Māra by great bodhisattva beings.

original: rig par byas nas rnam par spang bar bya'o //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /🔽bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: rig par byas nas rnam par spang bar bya'o // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis / bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having known them, they should be abandoned.🔽” The venerable Su­bhūti then said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bdud kyi las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rig par bgyi ste /
analyzed: bdud kyi las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rig par bgyi ste /
translated: “The bodhisattva mahāsattvas should know the activities of Māra.

original: spang par bgyi ba de dag gang lags /
analyzed: spang par bgyi ba de dag gang lags /
translated: “What are the works of Māra that bodhisattva great beings should know and abandon?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las /🔽rab 'byor / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las /🔽rab 'byor / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs @89b brnyan ni bdud kyi las /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las / rab 'byor / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las / rab 'byor / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs @89b brnyan ni bdud kyi las /
translated: “Subhūti, a counterfeit perfection of wisdom is a work of Māra.🔽Subhūti, a counterfeit perfection of concentration is a work of Māra.🔽Subhūti, a counterfeit perfection of perseverance is a work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las /
analyzed: rab 'byor / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las /
translated: Subhūti, a counterfeit perfection of patience is a work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las /
analyzed: rab 'byor / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las /
translated: Subhūti, a counterfeit perfection of morality is a work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las te /🔽de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las te / de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rig par bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, a counterfeit perfection of giving is a work of Māra.

original: rnam par spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par spang bar bya'o //
translated: Those are works of Māra that bodhisattva great beings should know and abandon.”🔽“Lord, what are the counterfeit perfections?”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i mdo sde dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i mdo sde dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should also know the Sutras associated with the Vehicle of the Sravakas and the Vehicle of the Pratyekabuddhas,

original: rnam par spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par spang bar bya'o //
translated: and should avoid them.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should know the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of the compounded,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the emptiness of the uncompounded, the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, the emptiness of beginningless and endless, the emptiness of non-rejection, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang /🔽yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang @90a *//
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang @90a *//
translated: the emptiness of defining characteristics, the emptiness of nonobservation, the emptiness of nonentities, the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of nonentities.🔽The four establishments of mindfulness,

original: chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa gang gis /
analyzed: chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa gang gis /
translated: the four right efforts, the four legs of magical manifestation, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the four noble truths, the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, and the wishlessness gate of liberation.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba de dag kyang bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du byas shing /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba de dag kyang bdud sdig to can dag dge slong gi cha byad du byas shing /
translated: and those who will attain the fruit of stream enterer, the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, and a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, those too, Subhūti, will be approached by Māra, the evil one, in the guise of a monk,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la nye bar bsnyen te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la nye bar bsnyen te /
translated: and will stand in front of those bodhisattva great beings

original: de'ang de la dga' ba skyed na /
analyzed: de'ang de la dga' ba skyed na /
translated: and, having given rise to joy in them,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, that too is a condition that is not conducive to this deep perfection of wisdom being written out, taken up, borne in mind,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, that too should be known by the bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.”🔽“Furthermore, Subhūti, when this deep perfection of wisdom is being written out,

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag sangs rgyas kyi cha byed du lus gser gyi kha dog dang / mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / 'od 'dom gang ba dang ldan par byas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag sangs rgyas kyi cha byed du lus gser gyi kha dog dang / mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / 'od 'dom gang ba dang ldan par byas shing /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one, having transformed himself into the form of a Buddha with a golden-colored body, the thirty-two marks of a great man, and a fathom-wide aura,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du 'ongs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du 'ongs te /
translated: approaches a bodhisattva great being

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mos pa skyed do //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mos pa skyed do //
translated: and generates devotion in him.

original: des mos pa bskyed nas /
analyzed: des mos pa bskyed nas /
translated: Having generated devotion,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams par @90b 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams par @90b 'gyur te /
translated: he causes him to fall away from the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, this too is a condition that does not facilitate writing out, taking up, reading aloud,

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: reciting, or fully understanding this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, this too should be known by a bodhisattva great being as the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i mdun du sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun nye bar ston te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i mdun du sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun nye bar ston te /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one will manifest in front of that son of a good family or daughter of a good family a Buddha and the community of monks.

original: des de la 'dod pa bskyed cing /🔽bdag kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: des de la 'dod pa bskyed cing / bdag kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
translated: He will cause them to generate desire,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'di lta bur shog cig /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'di lta bur shog cig /
translated: thinking, “In the future, may I also become a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One like this one.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa 'dis tshogs yongs su bsdus pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa 'dis tshogs yongs su bsdus pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang tshogs yongs su bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Just as this Tathāgata has gathered the assembly, so also will I gather the assembly.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dis chos ji ltar ston pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dis chos ji ltar ston pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: Just as this Tathāgata teaches the Dharma, so also will I teach the Dharma.”

original: zhes de de la 'dod pa bskyed pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes de de la 'dod pa bskyed pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of generating desire for that, they will decline from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Subhuti, this also is a sign that the causal basis for writing out, studying, and reciting this deep perfection of wisdom will be lacking.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, this also should be known by the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva as the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag byang chub sems dpa' brgya phrag du ma /🔽byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag du ma /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig to can dag byang chub sems dpa' brgya phrag du ma / byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag du ma /

original: byang chub sems dpa' brgya stong phrag du ma /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brgya stong phrag du ma /

original: sbyin pa'i @91a *//
analyzed: sbyin pa'i @91a *//

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: to practice the perfection of morality, to practice the perfection of patience, to practice the perfection of perseverance, to practice the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de lta bu dag nye bar ston te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de lta bu dag nye bar ston te /
translated: they teach them the perfection of wisdom,

original: de'ang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ba de dag la 'dod pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'ang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ba de dag la 'dod pa skyed par 'gyur ro //

original: des de dag la 'dod pa bskyed nas /
analyzed: des de dag la 'dod pa bskyed nas /

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: they will fall away from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / bsgom pa dang tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i rgyu rkyen mi ldan pa ste /

translated: Subhūti, that is also a causal factor that is not conducive to writing out, reading aloud, clearly articulating, reciting, teaching, or properly paying attention to this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //

translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom has many obstacles.

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag la'ang bar chad du 'gyur ba mang ngo //

translated: “Subhūti, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who write out this deep perfection of wisdom, take it up, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, teach it, and properly pay attention to it will have many obstacles.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / dzambu'i gling 'di rin po che gser dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel @102a *//

translated: Subhūti, it is like this:🔽all the jewels, gold, pearls, beryl, conch shells,🔽crystals,

original: dang; byu ru dang / dngul dang / sa le sbram gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag ni bar chad du 'gyur ba mang zhing phyir rgol ba mang ba dag go /

translated: coral, silver, and refined gold in this Jambudvīpa have many obstacles and many adversaries.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag la'ang bdud kyi las mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽bar chad mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

translated: In the same way, Subhūti, many a deed of Māra will occur to those sons and daughters of good family who copy out, take up, study, explain, recite, teach, and properly pay attention to this deep perfection of wisdom.🔽Many an obstacle will occur.

original: phyir rgol ba mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Many an adversary will occur.🔽Subhūti said,

original: de ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin te /
translated: it is so,

analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa de ni de bzhin te /

translated: in the same way, many māras’ deeds, many obstacles, and many adversaries will arise for those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who write out, recite, explain, or properly pay attention to this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de dag la'ang bdud kyi las mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de dag la'ang bdud kyi las mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, many māras’ deeds, many obstacles, and many adversaries will arise for those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who write out, recite, explain, or properly pay attention to this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: bar chad mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar chad mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Many obstacles will arise.

original: slar rgol ba mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar rgol ba mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Many adversaries will arise.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: skyes bu @102b glen pa gang rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton bgyid pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa dag gi bar chad bgyid pa ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu @102b glen pa gang rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton bgyid pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa dag gi bar chad bgyid pa ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
translated: those foolish people who create obstacles for sons of good family and daughters of good family who write out, read aloud, clearly articulate, teach, and properly pay attention to this deep perfection of wisdom are inspired by Māra.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: skyes bu glen pa de dag ni blo chung zhing blo zhan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu glen pa de dag ni blo chung zhing blo zhan par 'gyur ro //
translated: those foolish people will have little intelligence and weak intelligence.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: skyes bu glen pa gang rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton bgyid pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de dag gi bar chad bgyid pa de dag ni blo rgya shin tu chung par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes bu glen pa gang rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton bgyid pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de dag gi bar chad bgyid pa de dag ni blo rgya shin tu chung par 'gyur te /
translated: those foolish people who create obstacles for sons of good family and daughters of good family who write out, read aloud, clearly articulate, teach, and properly pay attention to this deep perfection of wisdom will have very little intelligence.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rlabs pa che dag la de dag gi sems mi 'jug go /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rlabs pa che dag la de dag gi sems mi 'jug go /
translated: their minds do not engage with the vast qualities of the Buddha.

original: de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri /
analyzed: de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri /
translated: They do not ask questions about this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: mi klog / lung mi 'bog kha ton mi bgyid /
analyzed: mi klog / lung mi 'bog kha ton mi bgyid /
translated: do not read it aloud, do not receive it, do not recite it,

original: mi sgom / tshul bzhin du yid la mi bgyid de /
analyzed: mi sgom / tshul bzhin du yid la mi bgyid de /
translated: do not meditate on it, and do not properly pay attention to it.

original: gzhan 'dri zhing klog pa dang / kha ton bgyid pa dang; ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa dag la'ang bar chad bgyid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan 'dri zhing klog pa dang / kha ton bgyid pa dang; ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa dag la'ang bar chad bgyid par 'gyur ro //
translated: They also create obstacles for others who ask questions about it, read it aloud, recite it, teach it, and properly pay attention to it.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri mi klog /🔽lung mi 'bog /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri mi klog / lung mi 'bog /
translated: Those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who do not ask questions about this deep perfection of wisdom, do not read it aloud,🔽do not receive it,

original: kha ton mi byed /
analyzed: kha ton mi byed /
translated: do not recite it,

original: mi sgom / tshul bzhin du yid la mi byed cing /
analyzed: mi sgom / tshul bzhin du yid la mi byed cing /
translated: do not meditate on it, and do not properly pay attention to it,

original: gzhan 'dri ba dang / @103a *//
analyzed: gzhan 'dri ba dang / @103a *//
translated: and also create obstacles for others who ask questions about it,

original: klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dag gi bar chad byed pa de dag ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
analyzed: klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dag gi bar chad byed pa de dag ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
translated: They will be under the influence of Māra, and will create obstacles for those who read, recite, explain, teach, and properly pay attention to this perfection of wisdom.

original: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa /
analyzed: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa /
translated: They will be beginners in the vehicle, and will not have planted wholesome roots.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu chung ba /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu chung ba /
translated: They will have very few wholesome roots.

original: sngon gyi rgyal ba la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsgrubs pa /
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal ba la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsgrubs pa /
translated: They will not have attended to wholesome roots in the past.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma zin pa sha stag 'byung ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma zin pa sha stag 'byung ste /
translated: They will not be assisted by spiritual friends.

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni blo chung zhing blo zhan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni blo chung zhing blo zhan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family will have small minds and weak minds.

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri /
translated: Those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family who do not ask about this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: mi klog / lung mi 'bog /
analyzed: mi klog / lung mi 'bog /
translated: who do not read it,

original: kha ton mi byed /
analyzed: kha ton mi byed /
translated: who do not recite it,

original: mi sgom / tshul bzhin du yid la mi byed cing /
analyzed: mi sgom / tshul bzhin du yid la mi byed cing /
translated: who do not meditate on it, and who do not properly pay attention to it,

original: gzhan 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dag gi bar chad byed pa dag ni blo rgya shin tu chung bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: gzhan 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dag gi bar chad byed pa dag ni blo rgya shin tu chung bar 'gyur te //
translated: They will be very limited in their intelligence, and they will create obstacles for others who write, read, explain, recite, teach, and properly pay attention to it.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rlabs po che dag la de dag gi sems mi 'jug go /🔽rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dag la bdud kyi las 'di dag kyang 'byung med kyi 'on kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rlabs po che dag la de dag gi sems mi 'jug go / rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dag la bdud kyi las 'di dag kyang 'byung med kyi 'on kyang /
translated: Their minds will not engage with the vast teachings of the Buddha.🔽Subhūti, these works of Māra will occur to those who write, read, explain, recite, teach, and properly pay attention to this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / lung 'bog cing kha @103b ton byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / lung 'bog cing kha @103b ton byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing /
translated: However, Subhūti, those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who write, read, explain, recite, teach, and properly pay attention to this profound perfection of wisdom

original: gong du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang; bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: gong du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang; bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: “Previously, I taught the perfection of meditative concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of discipline,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang; gong du nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang; gong du nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: and the perfection of generosity. I also taught the perfection of inner emptiness, the perfection of outer emptiness, and the perfection of outer and inner emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: It is to perfect the emptiness of emptiness. It is to perfect the emptiness of the great. It is to perfect the emptiness of the ultimate. It is to perfect the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: It is to perfect the emptiness of the unconditioned. It is to perfect the emptiness of what is beyond extremes. It is to perfect the emptiness of what is beyond beginning and end. It is to perfect the emptiness of nonrepudiation.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /🔽dngos po med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa @104a *//
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa @104a *//
translated: the perfection of the emptiness of inherent existence, the perfection of the emptiness of all phenomena, the perfection of the emptiness of defining characteristics, the perfection of the emptiness of nonapprehension,🔽the perfection of the emptiness of nonthings,

original: dang; ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / gong du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: dang; ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / gong du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: the perfection of the emptiness of essence, the perfection of the emptiness of the essence of nonthings, and the perfection of the higher applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dbang po rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / stobs rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dbang po rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / stobs rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: They perfect the correct exertions, the supports for miraculous ability, the faculties, the powers,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / gong du 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / bsam gtan rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / gong du 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / bsam gtan rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: the branches of awakening, the noble eightfold path, the noble truths, and the meditative concentrations.

original: tshad med pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: It is to perfect the immeasurables. It is to perfect the formless absorptions. It is to perfect the eight aspects of liberation. It is to perfect the nine serial steps of meditative absorption.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: It is to perfect the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are the gateways to liberation. It is to perfect the higher perceptions. It is to perfect the meditative stabilities.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs @104b par byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs @104b par byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: they perfect the dhāraṇī gateways, they perfect the powers of the tathāgatas, they perfect the fearlessnesses, they perfect the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: byams pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /🔽lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed cing //
analyzed: byams pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed cing //
translated: they perfect great love, they perfect great compassion, they perfect the distinct attributes of a buddha, they perfect the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed na /
translated: they perfect the knowledge of path aspects, and they perfect the knowledge of all things as they are and in all their aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ni sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, you should know that this is the power of the Buddha.

original: des rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri'o //🔽klog go // lung 'bog go /
analyzed: des rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri'o // klog go // lung 'bog go /
translated: “Those sons of a good family and those daughters of a good family will copy out this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: kha ton byed do //
analyzed: kha ton byed do //
translated: they will study it, they will take it up,🔽they will recite it from memory,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed do //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed do //
translated: they will properly pay attention to it,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: and they will perfect this deep perfection of wisdom itself.

original: gong du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //🔽brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: gong du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do // brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They will perfect the perfection of concentration.🔽They will perfect the perfection of perseverance.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They will perfect the perfection of patience.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They will perfect the perfection of morality.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //🔽gong du nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do // gong du nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They will perfect the perfection of giving.🔽They will perfect inner emptiness.

original: phyi stong pa nyid @105a *//🔽yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid @105a *//🔽yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They will perfect outer emptiness.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the emptiness of the external and the internal.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the emptiness of emptiness.

original: chen po stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the emptiness of the great.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //🔽'dus byas stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do // 'dus byas stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽He perfects the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //🔽thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do // thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the emptiness of what is beyond extremes.🔽He perfects the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the emptiness of nonrepudiation.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
